New Records: Rahmanullah Gurbaz scored 84 runs in 45 balls for Afghanistan.
Sri Lanka opener Danushka Gunathilaka and Bhanuka Rajapaksa played crucial innings in the middle order.
Key Match Events: Bhanuka Rajapaksa and Danushka Gunathilaka shared a 32-run stand to stabilize Sri Lanka's innings after the loss of Dasun Shanaka.
Sri Lanka beat Afghanistan by 4 wickets with five balls to spare.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka skipper Dasun Shanaka won the toss and opted to bat first.
Afghanistan had a strong record in the tournament and were expected to put up a fight.
Post-Match Reflections: The win was a significant achievement for Sri Lanka in the Super Four stage of the Asia Cup.
Afghanistan's performance was criticized as they failed to chase down a manageable target.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was Afghanistan's opening game in the Super Four stage.
The game was played at the Sharjah Cricket Stadium.
